IRS990.MissionDesc: CUSHING ACADEMY, FOUNDED AS A COEDUCATIONAL BOARDING SCHOOL IN 1865, EXISTS FOR STUDENTS, THEIR ACADEMIC GROWTH AND THEIR PERSONAL DEVELOPMENT. WE ARE DEDICATED TO EDUCATING THE MIND, SHAPING THE CHARACTER, AND NURTURING THE CREATIVITY OF YOUNG MEN AND WOMEN. IN A COMMUNITY THAT IS ACADEMICALLY AND CULTURALLY DIVERSE, WE CHALLENGE EACH INDIVIDUAL, SUPPORT EXCELLENCE IN EVERY ASPECT OF THE LEARNING PROCESS, AND PROMOTE ACTIVE PARTICIPATION IN ALL AREAS OF LIFE AND LEARNING. WE OFFER A DEMANDING COLLEGE PREPARATORY CURRICULUM, TEACH SKILLS THAT BUILD CONFIDENCE, AND INSTILL VALUES THAT ENDURE.
IRS990.Desc: TRADITION, CHALLENGE AND EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITY FOR STUDENTS ACROSS THE COUNTRY AND AROUND THE WORLD IN WHICH TO EXPERIENCE GROWTH, SUPPORT AND SUCCESS THAT FLOURISH WITHIN THE COMMUNITY. CUSHING ACADEMY HAS 365 STUDENTS: 317 BOARD 48 DAYS. IN ADDITION, THE ACADEMY HAS 59 FULL TIME TEACHING FACULTIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CUSHING ACADEMY IS A MEMBER OF THE MASSACHUSETTS ASSOCIATION OF NONPROFIT SCHOOLS AND COLLEGES (MANS&C), A GROUP THAT MAY ENGAGE IN LOBBYING ACTIVITIES. THEREFORE, A PORTION OF THE DUES MAY BE ATTRIBUTABLE TO LOBBYING ACTIVITIES AND AS SUCH NO DETERMINATIVE AMOUNT IS LISTED IN THE SCHEDULE.
TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL GRANTS/SCHOLARSHIPS FOR QUALIFYING STUDENTS AND TO PROVIDE FUNDING FOR GENERAL EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS IN ACCORDANCE WITH DONORS' DIRECTIVES.

THE ACADEMY FOLLOWS FASB ASC 740, "INCOME TAXES", WHICH CLARIFIES THE ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES BY PRESCRIBING THE RECOGNITION THRESHOLD A TAX POSITION IS REQUIRED TO MEET BEFORE BEING RECOGNIZED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE ACADEMY RECOGNIZES A TAX BENEFIT FROM AN UNCERTAIN TAX POSITION ONLY IF IT IS MORE LIKELY THAN NOT THAT THE TAX POSITION WILL BE SUSTAINED ON EXAMINATION BY THE TAXING AUTHORITIES. MANAGEMENT EVALUATED THE ACADEMY'S TAX POSITIONS AND CONCLUDED THAT THE ACADEMY HAD NO MATERIAL UNCERTAINTIES IN INCOME TAXES AS OF JUNE 30, 2016 AND 2015. THE ACADEMY IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO INCOME TAX EXAMINATIONS BY THE U.S., FEDERAL, STATE, OR LOCAL TAX AUTHORITIES FOR FISCAL YEARS BEFORE 2013. THE ACADEMY WILL ACCOUNT FOR INTEREST AND PENALTIES RELATED TO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS, IF ANY, AS PART OF TAX EXPENSE.
FINANCIAL AID NETTED WITH REVENUE ON AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS -4,666,946. CHANGE IN FAIR VALUE OF INTEREST RATE SWAP AGREEMENTS 137,005.
COST OF GOODS SOLD REPORTED ON FORM 990, PART VIII, LINE 10B -330,965. SPECIAL EVENTS EXPENSE INCLUDED IN FORM 990, PART VIII, LINE 8B -105,920.
COST OF GOODS SOLD REPORTED ON FORM 990, PART VIII, LINE 10B 330,965. SPECIAL EVENTS EXPENSE INCLUDED IN FORM 990, PART VIII, LINE 8B 105,920.
FINANCIAL AID NETTED WITH REVENUE ON AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS 4,666,946.

THE ACADEMY PUBLICIZES ITS NONDISCRIMINATION POLICY ON ALL ADMISSION/MARKETING MATERIAL. IN ADDITION, AISNE (ASSOCIATION INDEPENDENT SCHOOL OF NEW ENGLAND) PLACES SEVERAL ADVERTISEMENTS IN NEW ENGLAND AREA PERIODICALS STATING ITS MEMBER'S NONDISCRIMINATION POLICY AND LIST EACH SCHOOL BY NAME.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.NonCashAssistanceDesc: ALL GRANTS ARE FOR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO ATTEND CUSHING ACADEMY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL GRANTS ARE BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED OR ACADEMIC MERIT. THE ACADEMY UTILIZES THE SERVICES OF A THIRD PARTY TO ANALYZE THE APPLICANT'S FINANCES TO DETERMINE THE ESTIMATED FAMILY CONTRIBUTION. THE FINANCIAL AID COMMITTEE MAINTAINS ALL RECORDS REGARDING THE SELECTING AND AWARDING OF GRANTS.

DUE TO THE RESIDENTIAL NATURE OF THE SCHOOL, CERTAIN EMPLOYEES, AS A CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT AND FOR THE CONVENIENCE OF THE EMPLOYER, RECEIVE ON-CAMPUS HOUSING. THE HEADMASTER AND DEAN OF ENROLLMENT SERVICES RECEIVED THIS NONTAXABLE BENEFIT DURING THE YEAR.
THE ACADEMY HAS A POLICY FOR ON-CAMPUS HOUSING.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.TransactionDesc: CHRISTOPHER TORINO'S WIFE IS A SALARIED EMPLOYEE OF THE SCHOOL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE NUMBER IN COLUMN B REPRESENTS THE TOTAL NUMBER OF DONORS OF NON-CASH ITEMS DURING THE YEAR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CAROL AND CHARLES SCHAEFER, TRUSTEES, HAVE A FAMILY RELATIONSHIP.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY SENIOR MANAGEMENT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: OFFICERS, KEY EMPLOYEES AND ALL BOARD MEMBERS ARE REQUIRED ANNUALLY TO COMPLETE AN ANNUAL DISCLOSURE AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST FORM. IF ANY CONFLICT EXISTS THE BOARD MEMBERS AND EMPLOYEES ARE NOT ALLOWED INPUT ON ISSUES THAT WOULD RAISE THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD CONTRACTS WITH A CONSULTING FIRM THAT REVIEWS PEER SCHOOLS 990'S, CONDUCTS SURVEYS AND REPORTS THEIR FINDINGS TO THE BOARD. THIS FORMAL PROCESS IS UNDERTAKEN PERIODICALLY (LAST COMPLETED IN MARCH 2013). IN THE INTERIM YEARS THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE (AN AD HOC COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD) REVIEWS PEER SCHOOLS 990'S AND OTHER AVAILABLE DATA.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, FORM 990, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST FOR THE SAME PERIOD OF DISCLOSURE AS SET FORTH IN SECTION 6104(D). IN ADDITION THE FORM 990 IS AVAILABLE VIA GUIDESTAR AND THE MASSACHUSETTS ATTORNEY GENERAL'S WEBSITE.
CHANGE IN FAIR VALUE OF INTEREST RATE SWAP AGREEMENTS: 137,005.
